Compound.comment:
UDP-glucose is an activated form of glucose that participates in a variety of enzymatic reactions, including:

1. Biosynthesis of glucose-containing compounds, such as polysaccharaides (glycogen, starch, laminarin and cellulose), disaccharides (sucrose, trehalose), β-glucosides, and glucosyl-ceramides.

2. Channeling galactose into the glycolytic pathway

It has also been suggested that UDP-D-glucose can act as an extracellular signaling molecule [Lazarowski03].

Person.comment: Ron Caspi has been a curator of the MetaCyc database at SRI International since 2005.
